comments.body: Can we not skip the last argument (default) if it's the obvious default? I understand for `kBlack` and maybe `false`, but I find it a bit annoying to having to specify `0` of whatever shape or form :-) Or does the `_normal` trigger anything?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +31,35 @@public:

   RAttrValue<RPadLength> left{this, "left", 0._normal};     ///<! left margin
   RAttrValue<RPadLength> right{this, "right", 0._normal};   ///<! right margin
   RAttrValue<RPadLength> top{this, "top", 0._normal};       ///<! top margin

comments.body:
That's unfortunate - why can we not just use the default (i.e. not declare this)?

If we have to declare this (though I don't know why yet), don't we need to also declare the copy constructor, move constructor, move assignment op?

If those are part of `R__ATTR_CLASS`, why aren't the copy constructor, move constructor, move assignment op part of it, too?
